page.title: 05LAW AND ORDER IN HARWICH
page.content: THERE ARE 37 OFFICERS WORKING AT THE HARWICH POLICE STATION, INCLUDING 2 COMMUNITY POLICE OFFICERS AND 4 POLICE WOMEN. HARWICH DOES NOT HAVE A DOG HANDLER. THE STATION HAS SEVERAL MOBILE PATROLS INCLUDING 2 FORD SIERRAS WHICH ARE "AREA" CARS, 1 FORD TRANSIT VAN, 2 CHEVETTES, 1 ESCORT AND 4 BICYCLES. THE POLICE STATION HAS FOUR CELLS AND NO ONE HAS ESCAPED FROM THEM FOR AT LEAST 15 YEARS. THERE ARE TWO COURT ROOMS IN THE HARWICH TOWN HALL. THE MAGISTRATES COURT IS HELD EVERY TUESDAY, WHILST THE JUVENILE COURT IS HELD ON ALTERNATE FRIDAYS. THE AVERAGE NUMBER OF CASES GOING TO COURT WEEKLY IS 20. IN HARWICH THE MOST COMMON OFFENCE IS THEFT WHILST THE LEAST COMMON CRIME IS OFFENCES AGAINST A PERSON. MOST CRIMES ARE COMMITTED IN THE EVENING, AND THERE ARE MORE JUST BEFORE XMAS.
